ingredients: Ricotta, apple, sardines, anchovies, black pepper on sourdough
tasting_notes: I love this sandwich.  Though it seems like it is not for everyone. Sam has also eaten this sandwich.

ingredients: Falafel
location: Damascus Bread and Pastry Shop, 195 Atlantic Ave

ingredients: Shrimp po' boy: battered fried shrimp, lettuce, tomato, pickles, hot sauce
tasting_notes: Cheeky Sandwiches is one of my favorite places to buy sandwiches because their chicken sandwich is SO GOOD.  This po' boy was less impressive.  The bread seemed a little stale and as we all know, bread is important

ingredients: Corned beef, swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, salt, pepper, banana peppers
tasting_notes: This sandwich is a lot like sandwiches from Hogan Brothers (Northfield, MN).  I do like that they give you the option to heat your sandwich without toasting the bread.

ingredients: avocado, salt, pepper on whole wheat sourdough (open face)
tasting_notes: this sandwich never fails to be delicious

ingredients: BLT with olive oil mayonnaise (what does that even mean?? it means it's made with olive oil not lard. i think. http://www.foodrenegade.com/decoding-labels-spectrum-organic-mayonnaise-olive-oil/ - aliya) on country white
tasting_notes: The bread on this sandwich was so of brittle/crumbly which I did not like -sf

ingredients: turkey, brie, cranberries, pesto
tasting_notes:
grilled like a panini. it was delicious, although a bit greasy and probably not very good for you. I would have preferred it had some arugula or spinach or something else a bit more lively to counteract the heavy cheese. But very enjoyable for an alternative turkey sandwich.
paid for by Nato Thompson.

ingredients: chicken kebab sandwich
tasting_notes: The chicken was very well cooked, hot suace was a great addition

ingredients: avacado, salmon, brie and tomato
tasting_notes: DELIGHTFUL

ingredients: roast beef sandwich
tasting_notes: i brought it from home; it was an okay sandwich

ingredients: burrito: beans, fresh herb salad, corn, chipotle from a can (!), chilula, brown rice, cheese, broiled.
price: not sure, made mostly of food leftovers other people bought
tasting_notes: While the burrito holds a contriversal sandwich status, I think this deserves mention because A) it embodies one of the best things about sandwiches -- you can put any sort of random stuff from the refrigerator onto it and it generally (when well curated) tastes great! B) after eating it, I exclaimed, "I LOVE BURRITOS!"

ingredients: Tunisian Tuna with harrisa, hard boiled egg, cured lemon chopped israeli salad & olives
tasting_notes: I have almost tried every sandwich at Cafe Petisco.  This one was a little weird but mostly delicious

ingredients: hummus, jarlsburg, spring mix lettuce, salt and pepper on 12 grain
tasting_notes: adding salt & pepper can do wonders for a sandwich

ingredients: Tuna, olive tapanade, cherry tomatos
tasting_notes: A delightful summery sandwich.  Olive tapanade is a wonderful sandwich ingredient

ingredients: smoked trout, marinated onions, parsley, lemon, mustard, potatoes on nice baguette
price: $9 (i think?) (free for me -- got it at the end of the day before they were throwing them out)
tasting_notes:
OMG IT WAS SO GOOD! you'd think with bread AND potato it'd be too much but it wasn't it was perfect. and the parsley is key -- a nice fresh light balance. you kinda end up with fishy breath afterwards but it's so worth it. really it's like the classiest tuna sandwich you've ever had. but more like a nicoise salad.
while i'd be hesitant to actually pay $9 for a sandwich, this was totally worth it free. I ate two. I'd even probably buy it for realz as a midday sandwich.

ingredients: soppressetta, goat cheese and olive tapenade panini
tasting_notes: delicious. SImply delicious. So big that it lasted two meals

ingredients: Avocado, salt and pepper on 9 grain (open face)
tasting_notes: I eat this sandwich all the time.  Always great.

ingredients: Pork chop, apple, mustard on challah
tasting_notes: The fried chicken is really Cheeky's masterpiece but this is a solid sandwich

ingredients: Harissa falafel with hummus, israeli salad, pickled cabbage and tahini sauce
location: Taim Falafel & Smoothie Bar, West Village
tasting_notes: These people really know what they are doing

ingredients: Nutella, peanut butter and sriracha on 9 grain
tasting_notes: Nimo recommended I eat this sandwich.  And then Molly also recommended I try it.  It was great, though I want to try it again on higher quality bread.

ingredients: Two Veggie burgers (as the outside) with lentil soup in the middle
tasting_notes: I ran out of groceries--no bread, cheese, anything-- and had only veggie burgers and a tiny bit of lentil soup left so I made this weird thing. Surprisingly ok, but what a mess! You need gloves if you want to eat this wet sandwich with your hands.

ingredients: lentil and beet salad, olive tapenade on toasted whole wheat (open face)
tasting_notes: very good, but could have used something else...goat cheese?

ingredients: 2012 Melt
tasting_notes: sauteed seitan mushrooms spinach veggies hot cheese on toasted sub roll topped with garlic fries. this sandwich is DELICIOUS but it leaves  you thirsty for days.

ingredients: Saratoga Club: maple bacon, "zesty" chicken salad, some sort of lettuce, maybe tomato and POTATO CHIPS IN THE SANDWICH
tasting_notes: A+

ingredients: Meatball parm
tasting_notes: I mean jesus christ, we're talking about the pinnacle of sandwichcraft here

ingredients: http://www.seriouseats.com/recipes/2012/03/cadbury-creme-egg-salad-sandwiches-recipe.html
tasting_notes: have not tried this, maybe you should

ingredients: Serrano ham, fig spread, manchego, balsamic vinegar, arugula
tasting_notes: I liked this one more than the Italian but Sam felt oppositely.  We both agreed the bread was a little tough.  But overall, delicious sandwiches

ingredients: Italian
greek hummus and jarlsburg on whole wheat sour dough
tasting_notes: I am very congested so I couldn't really taste the sandwich

ingredients: Roasted Garlic hummus, baby spinach, red pepper hummus and Sriracha on whole wheat pita
tasting_notes: Really good sandwich! Also, I found it surprisingly filling. I brought hummus and pita and a random bag of babay spinch to work. Desperation is the invention of....good sandwiches? I think so.

ingredients: Huevos Rancheros: two fried eggs, cooked over-medium, and served with avocado, pickled jalapeños, a sauté of Ranchero peppers and onions, chipotle mayo and a spicy pinto bean and crumbled chorizo spread
tasting_notes: ditto to shan. interesting take on the torta with a bun instead of a big piece of bread...i'd say better bread to stuff ratio than your typical torta but small.

ingredients: Mexican Egg Sandwich: scrambled eggs served with avocado, pickled red onion, spicy black bean spread and Crispy Bacon
tasting_notes: Very delicious, a little small

ingredients: MEYER LEMON CHICKEN, Sun-dried Tomato Mayo, Kale, Olive Oil
tasting_notes: wish the lemon packed more bite, could have done with one more ingredient, not sure what. but still a very satisfying sandwich. i really appreciated the use of kale. more sandwiches should involve kale

ingredients: CANADIAN BACON, Radicchio, Cucumber Salad, Maple Mustard
PORK & SHRIMP CHORIZO, Sweet Potatoes, Pickled Rhubarb, Cilantro $9
tasting_notes: great combination of sweet and savory

ingredients: Peppered turkey, pea sprouts, jarlsburg, greek hummus, stone ground mustard on 6 grain with pumpkin seeds
tasting_notes: Not my best sandwich.  The bread was a little overwhelming and the pea sprouts not as delicious as I anticipated.

ingredients: Hillel Sandwich: charoset and horseradish on matzo
tasting_notes: delicious as well as symbolic

ingredients: Lamb Burger
tasting_notes: A+

ingredients: Peppered turkey, jarlsburg, greek hummus, stone ground mustard on 6 grain with pumpkin seeds OPEN FACE
tasting_notes: same as the sandwich I had on Thursday but open face, much better

ingredients: The Passed(over) Sandwich: Kosher Turkey leftovers (w/ gravy), kale red pepper onion saute combo, siracha/mayo, stone ground mustard on tuscan wheat
tasting_notes: not bad--would definitely eat it again; served with tomato soup (lots of black pepper)

ingredients: Seared asparagus spears, red onion soak in balsamic vinegar, hard boiled egg, red onion, French mustard, olive oil, and fresh dill
location: at home.  Based on this recipe: http://www.thekitchn.com/spring-sandwich-boiled-egg-seared-asparagus-pickled-onion-167365
tasting_notes: A very refreshing sandwich

ingredients: Serrano ham, fig spread, manchego, balsamic vinegar, arugula
tasting_notes: This was my second visit to Bierkraft and I was slightly less enthused.  The bread is very tough and bread is very important

ingredients: almond butter and strawberry jam on a toasted english muffin; open face yo
price: crazy cheap, like I don't even know
tasting_notes: almond butter is delicious, and there are no sandwiches mentioning it listed here, so i wanted to put this on everyone's radar. i had this sandwich for breakfast at 8, and i was totally satisfied until i had lunch at 1. i even used the silly 100 calorie english muffins that my gf makes us buy.

ingredients: falafel
location: Herm's Box (truck at 91st and Central Park West)
tasting_notes: This falafel is pretty good, especially in the food desert that is Central Park West.  I always get a little confused about the nature  of "white sauce" when I am ordering (is it tahini or mayo?) and often my falafel ends up a little heavy on the mayo.  Another funny thing:  I have probably bought a sandwich from the man at this food truck 8-10 times and this time he told me I have a British accent.  Doesn't make sense.

ingredients: Meat ball sandwich (#4) and some sort of pork & pate sandwich (#2)
tasting_notes: Outstanding Vietnamese sandwiches

ingredients: BLT
tasting_notes: Nothing too special.  My favorite thing about this sandwich is that it is listed on the breakfast menu.

ingredients: #1 (I can't remember the exact ingredients)
tasting_notes: Back for more!

ingredients: Grilled (shredded) cheese on wheat bread
location: At the apartment where I babysit
tasting_notes: Shredded cheese is not ideal for making grilled cheese sandwiches but otherwise an ok sandwich.  Harper (age 2) definitely liked it

ingredients: egg on a roll with: avocado, bacon, tomato (no cheese)
location: Back in the Kitchen (to go / eaten on the road)
tasting_notes: this was the ideal egg-on-a-roll combination. It took me 2 months to figure it out, but it was really perfect. tomato added enough juicyness, bacon the saltiness, and avo the creamy richness. no cheese was necessary. Served with love and a surprise cake-pop from cassie. a delicious and sentimental wassaic send-off as i drove back to nyc!

ingredients: Vegertarian Cubano
location: Grindhouse Deli ( sandwich of the month)
tasting_notes: FAKE MEAT(ham) ON FAKE MEAT(pork?) ON PICKELS ON MUSTARD ON SWISS CHEESE.So good.

ingredients: Home fries, tomatoes, lettuce and salsa verde on corn tortilla
tasting_notes: At the end of the month when there were no grociers left. Surprisingly not bad, pretty fresh and tasted like summer.

ingredients: scrambled egg, muenster and smoked salmon on a biscuit
tasting_notes: Cheeky's breakfast sandwiches do not dissapoint

ingredients: Cream cheese, marmalade and honey on Toast
tasting_notes: Not gonna like, basically an accident of a breakfast sandwich. I thought I had different indgredients and then it was too late to back out and I only had a couple minutes before the bus came, and I was anxious and just put some random shit on this toast. ALTHOUGH-i'd make it again, less honey though it was pretty sweet.

ingredients: chickpeas, kale, leftover hummus with hardboiled egg and eggplant on corn tortilla
tasting_notes: delicious combo. kale and chickpeas in tortilla is my go-to meal. but the hummus made it killing!

ingredients: Hummus, daikon radish, red pepper spread, sriracha and lettuce on 12 grain bread
tasting_notes: Not bad, but not my best creation. I had to eat it at a time when I wasn't even hungry, which in my opinion is the worst.

ingredients: Tuna Camping-club: typical tuna salad with mayo/celery & salt/pepper on whole wheat, but the crucial ingredient was the chopped BACON left over from breakfast that morning (extra crispy).
location: on the top of Wheeler Mountain in vermont
tasting_notes: I ate this with very sweet grapes, in retrospect, they should have been inside the sandwich.

ingredients: Pastrami with kraut, arugula, tomato and spicy mustard.
tasting_notes: As big a fan as I am of spice, I found this combo was a little out of balance. That being said, these sandwiches are always perfect to split with a friend.

ingredients: Smoked salmon, goat cheese, apples, spinach, capers and rasberry dijon vinaigrette
tasting_notes: Awesome.

ingredients: Horseradish hummus, homemade pesto, daikon radish and romaine on sprouted grain bread.
tasting_notes: Fridge cleaning roundup! Making your own pesto is such a gamechanger.

ingredients: man's wrap (1): lightly scrambled eggs, mexican frying cheese, avocado, a little cream cheese and cayenne pepper on a wrap
tasting_notes: cream cheese it totally optional, and can take the place of the frying cheese when that runs out

ingredients: Tuna melt (tuna salad, lettuce, tomato, cheese) on Rye
tasting_notes: The diner was closed but they still made us these sandwiches!  Ate them on a stoop.  Also the radio of filling to bread was crazy, did not fit well. But still delicious.

ingredients: smoked salmon, avocado, tomato, sprouts, bbq sauce, mayo on a wrap
tasting_notes: next time i'll try cream cheese instead of mayo, but otherwise was glad i substituted cucumbers for sprouts, and added bbq sauce

ingredients: Southwestern turkey sandwich (don't remember the exact ingredients.  I think pepperjack was involved)
location: Grocery store on the corner next to McNally Jackson bookstore in SoHo
tasting_notes: Great value.  Especially good once you add a little sriracha.

ingredients: Brie, almond, and fig sandwich (warmed up)
tasting_notes: This sandwich is really good, but it is missing a little something.  I there was another non-sweet flavor

ingredients: Bacon, egg and cheese on a roll
tasting_notes: I also ordered iced coffee: best breakfast.  This sandwich is one of my favorite things about living in Wassaic.  I am very excited to try more of Back in the Kitchen's lunch sandwiches this summer.  EVERYONE COME VISIT ME AND WE'LL GO TOGETHER.

ingredients: Turkey, arugula, tomato, really good mustard on rye
tasting_notes: Eve and Ryan got me this sandwich when I was really hungry but had to catch the train.  Extra delicious due to the circumstances.

ingredients: turkey, lettuce, tomato, mayo, pesto on rye
tasting_notes: This is Ryan's usual sandwich order at Cousin's

ingredients: avocado on whole grain (open faced)
tasting_notes: I never get tired of this sandwich.  We don't have a toaster.  Oven toasting is very hard to do right.

ingredients: hearty bread, tofu (raw), lettuce (from the LIC CSA), cucumbers, shit tons of yellow mustard, leftover baba ganoush from OMG PIZZA
location: walking around at work/doing work errands
tasting_notes:
the key in this sandwich was the baba ganoush which made the otherwise bland ingredients come alive, and also made my lame day at work more delicous and lovely remembering eating the babaganoush the first time.

also, this was the second day that i had been carrying around a whole tomato around with me all day with intentions to put it on my sandwich but never did it so I still have a tomato in my backpack as I write this.

ingredients: egg, pepperjack and bacon on a roll with hot sauce
location: Renny's next to the laundry mat
tasting_notes: pepperjack made this sandwich extra tasty

ingredients: salami, swiss and arugula with mustard and mayo on sour dough
tasting_notes: I bought a lot of salami at the grocery store so there are a lot of salami sandwiches in my future

ingredients: homemade mozzarella, homemade tomato sauce, romano, fresh basil one-face on sour dough
tasting_notes: note: I had a sandwich for every meal today!

ingredients: veggie philly cheese steak sandwich: nice squishy baggette type bread, chicken-style seitan (seasoned with c-spices), medium sharp cheddar, butter, open face toasted in broiler. optional addition of arugula (fresh from the LIC CSA!!)
price: lots of whole foods moneys (mostly cuz we got carried away with non-sandwich groceries)
tasting_notes: this sandwich was delish, although man says it's not his best. it was crunchy and delicous and cheesy and did not make you feel inadequate or lacking or hungry even without meat. aliya really enjoyed the addition of arugula for a peppery earthy veggie infusion in the otherwise somewhat dense sandwich experience

ingredients: pepper jack, pepper turkey, arugula, cucumber, salt and pepper on whole wheat sour dough
tasting_notes: one of my better homemade sandwiches

ingredients: whoopie pie (from the best bakery in southern maine): 2 chocolate cakes with frosting/cream in the middle
location: the bus from Portland, ME to NYC
tasting_notes: i ate the whole thing myself for dinner. it was delicious. no shame.

ingredients: pepper jack, pepper turkey, arugula, cucumber, salt and pepper on cheddar-jalapeno ciabatta from the farmers market
tasting_notes: the cheddar-jalapeno ciabatta doubled the deliciousness of this sandwich

ingredients: Salmon salad (canned salmon, scallons, basil, dill, mayo, mustard, pepper), mustard greens on olive bread
tasting_notes: Canned salmon isn't really something that was on my radar but it has A LOT of potential for great sandwiches.  Eve has taught me a lot of good sandwich tips.

ingredients: Spinach, cracked pepper turkey, mayo, sour cherry chutney, sugar, salt and pepper on Berkshire Mtn Bakery Sunny Flax
tasting_notes: very nice.  sour cherry chutney needs to get some more use.

ingredients: spicy black bean vegi burger, two slices of pepper jack, mayo, sriracha and arugula on cheddar-jalapeno ciabatta
tasting_notes: YOU CAN'T LOSE WITH THIS CIABATTA!!!

ingredients: Brisket Sandwich
tasting_notes: Big W's is an amazing place. Their sandwiches are not to be missed. Some things I learned: when they ask what kind of bbq sauce you want, say one of each; put your coleslaw on your sandwich; the best sides are the corn pudding, the fruit compote and the "something green"

ingredients: i had excellent identical sandwiches today. hot dogs with sauteed sweet onions and nathan's mustard on slices of grainy batard. open faced.
tasting_notes: side of beans. coffee egg cream.

ingredients: Bacon, egg and cheese and HOT SAUCE on a roll
tasting_notes: I don't know why I hadn't thought of putting hotsauce on this sandwich until Raoul suggested it. Definitely the right choice.

ingredients: Pepper jack, pepper turkey, arugula, avocado salt and pepper on herb ciabatta from the farmers market
tasting_notes: This sandwich has been a staple of my summer.  Not surprisingly the avocado brought it to a new level.

ingredients: BLT
tasting_notes: I realized this BLT is so good because they put mustard on it.  Great move.

ingredients: "The Nantucket" : really good turkey, cheddar, cranberry sauce, granny smith apple, mayo, and dijon on sourdough
tasting_notes: I can't figure out what makes this sandwich so good. I think it might be the mayo & mustard? the mustard is really spicy. or the bread? or the turkey? or maybe its the SYNTHESIS?

ingredients: double cream brie, humbolt fog, arugula, fig spread, caramelized onions, balsamic, on baguette
tasting_notes: This is my favorite sandwich. I have been meaning to write about it for a long time and continued to forget. I was also intimidated by the lack of love for bierkraft in sandwich club. I whole-heartily believe Bierkraft has the best veggie sandwich options in NYC besides maybe that Cambodian sandwich place in Manhattan that I'm forgetting the name of. This sandwich is the best. Perfect combo of sweet and savory. the textures meld perfectly and the arugula adds a fresh and spicy kick. They should put it up on the board, its just that good. Order it and you won't be disappointed. Better yet, share it with a friend and split an unforgettable ice cream sandwich for dessert! I have tried many combinations including adding mustard, adding sun dried tomatoes, trying a hard cheese in addition to the brie, all of these were also delicious but i like the aforementioned ingredient combo the best.

ingredients: "The Breanne" : Egg, cheese, bacon and avocado on a roll
tasting_notes: Fellow club member, Breanne Trammell, told me that at Back in the Kitchen if you get anything with avocado on it, it is called "The Breanne."  I hadn't realized you could customize sandwiches.  SO MUCH POTENTIAL. Breanne also recommends adding roasted tomatoes.

ingredients: two fried eggs with salt and pepper on toasted sour dough with homemade siracha mayo, sauteed cabbage with salt, pepper, olive oil, garlic and onions, and grated pecorino from the pizza boys (definitely staggionato)
tasting_notes: Doug and Josh ate them, too!

ingredients: Meatloaf sandwich
tasting_notes: I really appreciate that kimchi is an option for your side.  Also, Ben ate a garden burger that looked amazing.

ingredients: Peppered bacon, tomatos, avocado, mustard on whole wheat sourdough
tasting_notes: Prepared by Eve

ingredients: house cured tuna, black olive tapenade, roasted tomatoes, arugala, olive oil, lemon, baguette
tasting_notes: near-perfect balance between salty tuna and tapenade and sweet, buttery tomatoes and pepper arugula

ingredients: grilled tofu in sesame sauce, sautéed spinach and melted brie in a flour burrito wrap
tasting_notes: holy crap this was better than i was expecting. i cooked the tofu on just this side of crispy, which i think made the difference relative to the creamy brie and spinachy spinach. well, also the tofu and spinach were cooked in a liberal amount of butter.

ingredients: Marinated mock duck, with caramelized onions, roasted red peppers, swiss cheese on a Ciabatta roll
tasting_notes: Didn't help in my never-ending search to figure out which is better: mock duck or duck

ingredients: Meatloaf, butter lettuce, tomato, bacon mayonaise
tasting_notes: Bacon Mayonnaise is a crazy but delicious idea

ingredients: Turkey, provolone, gouda, red onion, micro greens, homemade garlic aioli on a toasted baguette
location: My sister's condo in Seattle, WA. She made it.
tasting_notes: This is my first contribution to this spreadsheet. I have been a distant admirer for some time, but now I will become an ACTIVE PARTICIPANT. Can't wait.

ingredients: Prosciutto, arugula, fontina and fig jam panini. Dipped in potato leek soup for double whammy.
Breakfast bagelwich: veggie chix patty, fried egg, and sriracha on an everything bagel
location: Breakfast nook, my apartment, Mpls near Loring Park
tasting_notes: Most of the sandwiches I eat are breakfast sandwiches. Shannon, I got my sticker!

ingredients: "The Western": double beef patty, fried onions, pepperjack, bacon
tasting_notes: Onion rings, french fries on side. This is more of a special occasion hamburger than an everyday hamburger.

ingredients: Deluxe hamburger: Hamburger, lettuce, tomato, mayo, ketchup
tasting_notes: Onion rings on the side

ingredients: some giant slices of garden ripe tomato crisp organic bacon mayo on a challah roll.
tasting_notes: side: potato chips, beverage: chocolate egg cream

ingredients: slices of a yellow heirloom tomato (yellow cherokee, I think?) plus mayonnaise on an ak-mak cracker with black pepper on top. Openfaced!
tasting_notes: THE QUINTESSENTIAL SUMMER SANDWICH. mayonnaise is the best tomato accompaniment. An earlier incarnation is pictured here: http://doubleoven.tumblr.com/image/29005198690

ingredients: Brie, gala apple and arugula on multigrain
tasting_notes: Getting ready for fall!

ingredients: A fried egg (over very easy), thin shavings of cheddar, two slices of  salami, mayo, and sriracha on two pieces of crist toast.
tasting_notes: A thrown together concoction that actually tastes pretty damn good.

ingredients: Meatloaf (preferably leftover), spring mix, mayo, chutney, corn salsa on rye (should be toasted)
toast (open faced) with tomato paste, white extra sharp cheddar cheese, oregano, black pepper, poached egg . BROILED, BITCHES
tasting_notes:
THE POACHED EGG PIZZA-TOAST IS THE NEW REVOLUTION. watch out, world, this sandwich is about to take over.
SPICES ARE KEY FOR THE TRUE PIZZA OVEN-AT-HOME-EXPERIENCE

ingredients: BLT (unfortunately using some kind of Miracle Whip in place of the mayonnaise I was hoping for)
tasting_notes: Awful. Shame-inducing. I later ate some fantastic Thai curry and felt very stupid for stopping at Amazing.

ingredients: BBQ mock duck on a hoagie roll w/tater tots
location: Grumpy's on Washington Ave S, downtown Mpls
tasting_notes: Fine to good? No surprise w/r/t sauce or toppings, but I won't complain about a bar that serves seitan dishes.

ingredients: Brie, carmelized onions, mango chutney, turkey on toasted multigrain
tasting_notes: phenomenal

ingredients: Egg salad, wheat toast, arugala, salt, pepper
tasting_notes: sandwich was good-yes, it might be better with dill, but eating it was lots and lots of fun.

ingredients: roasted turkey, swiss, lettuce, shitty tomatos on whole wheat. little bit of ranch too (not gonna lie to you)
location: fucking quizno's on my way home from school, NY thruway
price: too much it makes me sad
tasting_notes: i ate half in the car at 2pm. other half for dinner at 7, HOWEVER for the 2nd half I added half an avocado, ton of spicy mustard, nutritional yeast and a decent amount of pepper which made it much more tolerable. :( :)

ingredients: i just had a bologna and mustard on a fresh challah roll.
tasting_notes: bliss with a fizzy lizzy raspberry lemon.

ingredients: BLT on multigrain
tasting_notes: A little heavy on the mayo. The multigrain bread was great though.

ingredients: mushroom, artichoke, provolone, pesto and special "dirty sauce" on dutch crunch
tasting_notes: amazing, dutch crunch is the best!

ingredients: lightly battered/fried chicken breast, hot sauce, honey butter on buttermilk biscuit
tasting_notes: PERFECTION. never met a chicken biscuit i didn't like from P & T. was with Jeila and we split a squash side salad (6$) and cheese grits (4$). so best.

ingredients: Tuna melt (tuna salad, swiss and tomato on "dark bread")
tasting_notes: I try and pretend like tuna melts aren't great, but they really are. That being said, I ate it on the waterfront and I kept thinking about how much better it would have been with a little hot sauce.

ingredients: Honey mustard chicken salad on toasted wheat with lettuce, tomato, swiss, avocado
location: back in the kitchen, amenia ny
tasting_notes: I was reluctant to order this given the honey mustard (never a fan) but Cassie told me it was a subtle honey. Delicious. Chips and pickle on the side.

ingredients: Peppered salami, cheddar, mustard on whole wheat
tasting_notes: Pickles on the side, but too much flavor overlap between mustard and pickle for maximum pickle deliciousness; lesson learned

ingredients: The "R Burger": The bread/bun was sort of the consistency of a pork bun but a little denser, a patty made of chicken and spices, lettuce, onion, some sweet (teriyaki?) sauce
tasting_notes: The bread was a little strange, but the patty was very well seasoned

ingredients: Italian beef (incl pickled peppers, what appears to be meat juice or "jus")
tasting_notes: Really, really delicious. Bread saturated in meat juice was a huge pro, in my book. Potato salad on the side

ingredients: Breakfast bagelwich: veggie chix patty, fried egg, and sriracha on an everything bagel
location: Breakfast nook, my apartment, Mpls near Loring Park
tasting_notes: Guy in the apartment below me gets out of bed really early and plays his wake-up music way too loud

ingredients: Egg salad and smoked salmon on toasted wheat [?] with lettuce, tomato
tasting_notes: Would have enjoyed more salmon, but then that'd be true no matter what. If you're gonna toast the bread then TOAST. IT.

ingredients: Egg and cheese on a bialy
tasting_notes: I would eat this every day if I could.

ingredients: Serrano ham, fig spread, manchego, balsamic vinegar, arugula
tasting_notes: Pretty fucking good, although I always feel like something is missing from their suggested sandwich combos....

ingredients: Goat cheese, spinach, tomoato, avocado, apple red onion, raspberry dijon vinaigrette
tasting_notes: They skimped on the goat cheese, but mmmmmm nonetheless

ingredients: ciabatta roll, swiss cheese, two slices Canadian bacon, fried egg, strawberry preserves
tasting_notes: sort-of croque madame, strawberry preserves a really good idea

ingredients: Croissant, fried egg, some kind of sharp cheese, tomato, avo., garlic aoli,
tasting_notes: This sandwich was incredible. It was huge considering it was on a croissant...i think they may make their own pastries (it certainly tasted like it!). the flavors melded into a delicious buttery heaven...and it came with a pickle wedge which is essential.

ingredients: Everything bagel with 1 egg, swiss and hot sauce
tasting_notes: The swiss was 75 cents extra but well worth it

ingredients: Grilled pork banh mi
tasting_notes: This sandwich was delicious though a little expensive given my expectations for bahn mi prices. Also, Hanco's was featured on The American Life a while ago: http://ny.eater.com/archives/2010/07/hancoshenrys_banh_mi_war_makes_this_american_life.php

ingredients: Turkey, avocado, gruyere and red onion on a roll
tasting_notes: The gruyere was expensive but made the sandwich very delicious. Sam put much more turkey on his sandwich plus mayo and mustard and seemed happy with it.

ingredients: Fava Bean spread with garlic(just a little!) and olive oil over homemade bread with sauteed bitter greens (like dandelion) - and sprinkle of parmeson - OPENFACED.
tasting_notes: This is solidly the most delicious thing anyone will ever eat. Fresh fava beans are essential.  They get shelled, boiled briefly, then shelled again, then mashed and cooked up with some finely chopped garlic and olive oil, and sauteed greens make the magic touch.  How often do you eat bitter food?????

ingredients: Smoked Turkey, smoked gouda, lettuce, tomato, banana peppers (turkey and cheese is heated, but the bread is untoasted)
tasting_notes: This sandwich was delicious and HUGE. Jeila and I split it which was a great solution.

ingredients: veg. turkey, tempeh bacon,  gouda, avocado, red onion, sundried tomatoes, sprouts, hot peppers, veganaise on rosemary garlic bread
tasting_notes: It's sort of a subway-style customize your own sandwich experience with much better ingredients. They have these little laminated cards with all the ingredients on them and you check off all the ones you want. With 10 kinds of cheese, 5+ vegetarian protein options, and 12 or so kinds of bread there's a ton of variety for vegetarians which I really appreciate

ingredients: garlic mashed yams, gravy, turkey, lettuce, and cranberry sauce on rosemary potato bread
tasting_notes: Thanksgiving leftovers make the best sandwiches

ingredients: Mayo, homemade cranberry sauce, braising salad mix with mustard greens, avocado, chamembert, avocado, smashed sweet potato, generous amount of pepper, nutritional yeast on toasted sourdough
tasting_notes: One of the best sandwiches I've made.

ingredients: Pulled Pork Mac and Cheese
tasting_notes: A duo of expected phenomena left in a lunch lady's tray a bit too long. Mango slaw couldn't make this sure shot happen. Ketchup as a last resort, the tomato-y lubricant needed to get this overly dry pair wrapped in a roll down my hunger hole. At least they forgot to charge me for my beer.

ingredients: Cubano
tasting_notes: Not delicious. A friend ordered the friend pork. It looked way more delicious

ingredients: Chicken salad on raisin nut bread
tasting_notes: This sandwich was very over priced. There wasn't even a piece of lettuce on it. But the raisin nut bread was a really good call.

ingredients: "Dads Couch" = chicken cutlet, bacon, swiss, tomato, honey mustard, on a poppy bagel (untoasted because La Bagel Delight's bagels are fresh and warm, never toasted)
location:
Originated at La Bagel Delight, 7th Ave, Park Slope
Renny's laundromat makes a good one, too, on a roll.
tasting_notes: Enjoy this sandwich on dad's couch on a Sunday or at the start of a long bus ride. The food coma will knock you out for hours.

ingredients: monte cristo - open face turkey, ham, swiss cheese, "maple" syrup on french toast
location: kellog's diner (whatever it was like 2am and i had just finished working all night and i got the mote cristo craving)
tasting_notes: this is one of my fav sammies, but kellog's blew it, big time. the turkey and ham were both so dry that almost no amount of syrup or swiss cheese goodness could resuscitate it.

ingredients: peanut butter, banana and cinnamon on 12-grain
location: (1987 - present) where HAVEN'T i eaten this classic?
tasting_notes: honey is a nice optional addition

ingredients: Pam PBJ- my old standard. Home Pride Butter Top Whole Wheat bread, Chunky JIF, Welch's Grape Jam
location: (date: all time) Morris Park Lane, East Hampton
tasting_notes: These are my brand preferences for my childhood PBJ *peanut butta jelly time!*

ingredients: Egg salamich on Rosemary Focaccia with tomatoes (diced), pickles (diced), salt n peppa
location: (date: Fall 2012) Eat it at the print shop at Columbia, purchased at Milano Market, 2892 Broadway, NYC
tasting_notes:
Dicing the tomatoes and pickles has these flavors meet the egg salad with even distribution. My most frustrating sandwich experiences are tomato slices slipping off of the sandwich or having too much filling and not enough bread. With the diced fillings, the square, stiff nature of the bread, and the perfect egg salad consistency, this high-piled egg salamich is just right. It's a simple taste, not too many flavors, but if you're an egg junkie, you'll appreciate this one.
I recommend this deli if you are into the mayo-based salamiches. They have many options. I hadn't willingly eaten mayonnaise in 20 years when this egg salad called out to me. It was amazing, and I've had at least 2 of these salamiches per week for the last 3 months.

ingredients: Roasted turkey, brie, cranberry mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion on fresh ciabatta
tasting_notes: Incredible. This is not a regular menu item, I combined various ingredients from two different sandwiches. I bought this to share with Anders but could have easily eaten the whole thing myself. Wish it came with chips and a pickle to round out my ideal sandwich scenario.

ingredients: Roasted turkey, arugula, roasted tomato, avocado, lemon oil mayo (which sounds redundant but I can't remember) on toasted ciabatta
tasting_notes: A variation on the above entry. Gotta say the sharon market sandwich is superior. w/ chips, pickle, iced macchiato.

ingredients: Chicken parm
tasting_notes: Overpriced but delicious

ingredients: Spicy roast beef, mushrooms, onions
tasting_notes: Also, overpriced but delicious

ingredients: Peanut butter and apple
tasting_notes: just the other day, diane was eating an open faced peanut butter and apple. what, you might say, is remarkable about that?? well, the apple slices were piled just a little high and the were slipping all over the place requiring during eating prop ups with a spare finger. a calamity of sandwich engineering.

ingredients: Spare ribs, beets, some sort of cheese
tasting_notes: A little meaty for me but definitely a good sandwich

ingredients: BLT
tasting_notes: The bacon was really delicious. Sort of sweet and smokey.

ingredients: Brisket Sandwich
tasting_notes: Great use of pickles.

ingredients: "organic" roasted turkey breast, avocado, mayo mixed with fresh lemon juice, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper on berkshire mountain bakery's cheddar jalepeno ciabatta roll
price: less than $5 but not exactly sure
tasting_notes: Would have been great to add tomatoes and leafy greens, but tomatoes are out of season and I made a kale side salad instead. Turkey and bread from food co-op in great barrington. The ciabatta is EXCELLENT. I sent Shannon a photo.

ingredients: Cochon Muffaletta
tasting_notes: Lightly toasted sesame seed bun was fluffy inside in contrast to "classic" muffaletta construction making for a lighter sandwich. Not so much a fan of olive tapenade as I'm not an olive fan, but I balanced it out with someÄ™spicy French mustard. Peppery pastrami and smoky ham elevated by house-made sweet pickles and salty potato chips rather than merely being balanced by them. Can a sandwich experience be symphonic? Well, it was. Perfect for sharing, too.

ingredients: Turkey, half avocado, asiago, spicy mustard, a ton of extra garlic-y kale pesto, nutritional yeast, big flakey sea salt on jalepeno ciabatta
tasting_notes: How did I not think to add kale pesto before?

ingredients: Sprouted wheat bread, avocado, babaganoush, olive tapanade, fried egg, mixed greens
tasting_notes: So.delicious.

ingredients: Chicken, goat cheese, sundried tomato, arugula, Russian dressing on French baguette
location: La Piccola Cucina, Upper West side
tasting_notes: Immediately after finishing, I saved the delivery number on my speed dial under "Sandwich"

ingredients: Yam sandwich
tasting_notes: The new Naum Pang location opened near my office and I have been eating there VERY frequently. I haven't been disspointed yet, but this yam sandwich was especially good.

ingredients: Pastrami
tasting_notes: We also had the brisket sandwich, which we agree was good but inferior to the pastrami. Also the sandwiches here come in S, M and L. The bread was extremely fluffy.

ingredients: Mongolian tofu and white bean salad
tasting_notes: A very flavorful and delicious sandwich. The white bean salad adds great crispness. Maybe too much mayo. Dana had the spare rib sandwich

ingredients: Peppered salami, horseradish goat cheese, arugula and dijon mustard
tasting_notes: This sandwich was a little too flavorful. I need to tone it down by adding some more nuetral ingredients.

ingredients: Pesto, Manchego cheese, butter lettuce, tomatoes and black olives on toasted wheat
tasting_notes: super refreshing, sharp flavors.

ingredients: Honey Glazed Ham on a buttermilk buiscuit with spicy mustard and maple bacon
tasting_notes: JESUS. I've been missing out on the pork-life. Although this sandich was delicious beyond what I could have imaged from the forbidden meat.

ingredients: BLT with fried egg in toast
tasting_notes: delicious

ingredients: Tomato and brie on baguette
location: Irving Farm Coffee, Grand Central Station
tasting_notes: Simple but delicious

ingredients: Egg, bacon, olives, steak, ham, mayo, tomato, mozzarella, lettuce, red pepper
tasting_notes: This sandwich was huge! Delicious but maybe over the top

ingredients: Pepper jelly, honey goat cheese, pepper turkey, arugula on Rye
tasting_notes: Pepper jelly is THE BEST. I was a little worried about the Rye but it worked surprisingly well

ingredients: BRELT: Standard BLT with avocado add-on (you can "BRE" anything at back in the kitchen aka add avocado)
tasting_notes: I substituted horseradish mayo for regular mayo, but honestly did not notice a difference. On toasted white bread (they were out of wheat). Roasted tomatoes are always a nice surprise. I tend to forget this is a standard feature. Kieran is not as generous with the avocado as Tory is in the morning (order the BRE breakfast sandwich)

ingredients: Thursday special: flank steak, cheddar, avocado, carmelized onions and horseradish mayo on a roll
tasting_notes: There was a lot of steak on this sandwich! Maybe too much. But the combination of flavors was great.

ingredients: French bread, sauteed onions, brie, arugula, and maybe a house sauce (I can't remember)
price: I don't remember, but it was under $10
tasting_notes: I wish the onions had been a little more caramelized, but I'm a sucker for a sauteed onion and this was pretty delicious.  The sandwhich was a little small, but it came with a side salad.  Also the cafe had a green tea ginger chai drink that was amazing.  I had it iced and with almond milk.

ingredients: Leberkäs-semmel
location: Rewe deli counter, München. I could've just said Munich, but this is a food document
tasting_notes: Leberkäs means "liver cheese," but is in fact neither. Think thickly sliced bologna, a la Spam serving size, in a semmel (bun). A dollop of spicy Bavarian mustard that flares your nostrils and makes your eyes water rounds out a cheap treat.

ingredients: toasted 7 grain and seed bread, sun-dried tomato hummus, extra sharp white cheddar cheese, avocado, and sriracha
price: free if I pretend that I didn't have to pay for groceries
tasting_notes: Great.  The hummus was very effective at keeping the avocadoes in the sandwich.  I hate when sandwiches fall apart and this one stayed together very well.

ingredients: Scrambled egg, white cheddar, chulula on english muffin
tasting_notes: A simple and easy sandwich. The english muffin made it extra good.

ingredients: cheese & steak sandwich (non-traditional) cheddar, sauteed mushroom & onion, thinnly sliced steak (not sure the cut), pea shoots, bbq sauce, added siracha to second half (excellent move) on cheddar ciabatta
tasting_notes: i was skeptical at first but willing to give it a try. jeff and bowie never do me wrong. it was amazing and shared with most excellent company.

ingredients: fried egg (in bacon grease), 1/2 avocado, homemade arugala/kale pesto, nutritional yeast, maldon sea salt, arugala, tomato on toasted sourdough
tasting_notes: avocado could have been more ripe. i'm obsessed with maldon salt. also made a blueberry / mango / banana smoothie.

ingredients: tzadziki on toast with spicy sopressata, fried eggs, parmeggian shavings and shiso
andouille sausage, sauteed red pepper and tons of garlic, red onion, avocado, pink lady apple slices, maldon sea salt on toasted ciabatta roll
tasting_notes: arugula side salad. the sandwiches were near the size of our faces. they were very good.

ingredients: Turkey Sandwich with lettuce, tomato, spicy mayo based sauce
tasting_notes: Best turkey sandwich I have ever had.  The turkey is marinated in honey, garlic and herbs and then slowly roasted.

ingredients: Grilled hamburger on toast with spread cheese tomato and onion
location: Louie's Lunch New Haven (birth place of the hamburger)

ingredients: Ham, gruyere, egg, tomato on some sort of fancy bun
tasting_notes: I was skeptical of the price ($7.50 for a breakfast sammie!), but I was impressed. Very tasty combo. Lots of salt. The bun really sealed the deal.

ingredients: Kippered salmon, house-made cream cheese and apple horseradish, on rye
tasting_notes: Perfect condiment-to-protein ratio, horseradish balanced perfectly with smoked salmon, good use of surface area. These Jews got game.

ingredients: Camenbert, pepper turkey, lingon berry spread, mayo, arugula on whole wheat
tasting_notes: I wish I had melted the cheese before assembling the sandwich. My friend Gabe recently said of camenbert: "Don't be afraid to melt it"

ingredients: Egg, cheese (can't remember what type), sausage, onions, peppers on a fancy roll
tasting_notes: The best part of this sandwich was that the onion and pepper was really finely chopped. It meant that the sandwich held together well and the onion and pepper flavors were evenly dispersed.

ingredients: Cheese, pickled jalapenos, breaded chicken, lettuce, tomato
location: 4th ave and 16th st in South Slope
tasting_notes: Kind of tasted like a jalapeno popper which I loved

ingredients: Bacon, hummus, american cheese. "The Hobo's Delight"
location: My house in Pittsburgh (New Academy Press)
tasting_notes: One slice of bread cut in half. Hummus on both sides of the bread. Cold leftover bacon from yesterday. Nothing special but an ok breakfast sandwish if you don't feel like cooking an egg.

ingredients: Pierogi and hotdog sandwich
tasting_notes: All the food items I had at the time combine into one sandwich. Heated hot dog and pre made pierogi in skillet all at once. "Butterfly" hot dogs for added bread coverage. Added pepperjack cheese to made it extra weird. Not too bad.

ingredients: Pepper turkey, pepper jack, pesto, arugula on flat bread
tasting_notes: Buying flatbread at the grocery store was a big mistake. Not even sure this would qualify as a sandwich. Definitely mediocre overall.

ingredients: Flat bread day two: pepper turkey, pepper jack, mayo, hot sauce and arugula on flat bread
tasting_notes: Not better than yesterday's sandwich. Flat bread is still getting me down. Though my folding technique did improve.

ingredients: Meatloaf, ketchup, mayo, lettuce and tomato
tasting_notes: This sandwich could use a little more pizzazz. Also did not hold together very well at all. Maybe the result of too much tomato?

ingredients: Apple-fig chutney, kale, lemon garlic aioli, and mozzarella cheese, grilled on mutigrain
tasting_notes: This was a really good sandwich that confirmed my hypothesis that all sandwiches are better grilled or toasted. The fig was a little too sweet in this context though. Also mozzarella is hard to bite so I ended up slurping whole pieces in and having a pretty uneven flavor experience.

ingredients: Everything bagel, untoasted, red onions, orange peppers, spicy mustard, pavelka farm ham (local Iowa City hamerie-sign up for their email), mozz, some sort of heirloom tomato (little yellow plums)
tasting_notes: I tossed it to a friend to demonstrate its girth to.....

ingredients: Turkey, green apple slices, cabot sharp white chedd, broccoli sprouts, spicy mustard on 5" roll
location: off-leash dog park, iowa city, ia
tasting_notes: Side of trader joe's white chedd booty, cucumber and tomato salad. What can be better than eating a sandwich surrounded by dogs and shared with a friend

ingredients: Pate I have been obsessed with pate with truffle lately. Goat cheese cause it's da bomb and grapes cause their in season on Sardinian parchment crackers. I know it's not on bread but cracker sandwiches make excellent afternoon snacks!
tasting_notes: Twas amazing fixed my late craving and then some.

ingredients: Leftover rib meat with kimchi, butter bread pickles, onions and a homemade mayo, hot sauce pepper jelly combo to spread all on a toasted baguette. This sandwich was great bc it contained items that were already in my fridge washed it down with some sparkling gratefruit water.
tasting_notes: Remicient of a Vietnamese Bahni Sandwich which I have been craving lately.

ingredients: Chicken and Waffle Sandwich. Chicken, one waffle, bacon, cheddar cheese, syrup, spicy mayo
tasting_notes: Really great. Worth $11. You can check out a picture of it here: instagram.com/endlessrevolt/

ingredients: Pita bread has been my new bread of choice its like putting your sandwich in a edible pocket. I filled mine with white fish salad, lettuce, avacado and sprouts yum yum
tasting_notes: So so good I loved white fish salad from Fairway its a gift from the Gods.

ingredients: Local sourdough, avocado, turkey, nasty creamy triple cream Brie, homemade green goddess dressing, cheddar & sour cream wavy lays (store brand)
fried chick patty, raw shredded cabbage, 1000 island like sauce, honey mustard(?) on a bun
tasting_notes: Very good. Orion ordered a burger that had a giant tomato slice and a sloppy joe type sauce. Also very tasty.

ingredients: Shrimp made into a patty and then fried, lettuce, some kind of tasty sauce. Served with a side of chicken nuggets.
tasting_notes: Mos Burger in Taiwan was very different then Japan. Way more seafood options.

ingredients: Doughly bread (similar to the outside of a pork bun), stewed pork, pickled vegetables, shredded cucumber, ground peanuts
tasting_notes: Peanuts as a condiment!

ingredients: French toast sandwich - jelly on one slice, cream cheese on the other
tasting_notes: the quality of this sandwich directly correlates to bread quality

ingredients: Almond butter, jam, dave's killer bread
tasting_notes: My uncle left some fancy almond butter at my house, it really made this sandwich extra delicious

ingredients: Number 6, (Spicy Chicken Sandwich)
tasting_notes: 4.5 out 5. A solidly consistent sandwich arcoss the board. Would order again. Highly recommend baconator fries as a side.

ingredients: "Thriller" sandwich, with modifications: Tofu Cutlet, veggie bacon, pepper jack cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, pesto sauce, on a hero.
tasting_notes: 3 out of 5. A little bland - pesto could use more salt. Tofu cutlet could have a more seasoned breading. Veggie bacon was soft, not crispy. Nevertheless, I ate the whole thing, and wasn't hungry for hours.

ingredients: fried egg, spinach, garlicky pickled radish, grain mustard on sourdough.
tasting_notes: pickly, mustardy egg satisfaction.
